Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a habitat, showing different areas on land or in water.
The student can include various plants and animals that live in the chosen habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, squirrels, ants, or fish.
The student can illustrate patterns in the diversity of plants and animals across different habitats.
The student can label the different types of living things included in their drawing.
The student can show different habitats by illustrating and comparing a land habitat and a water habitat.
The student can make sure that their drawing records observations that reflect the actual diversity seen in real-life habitats.
